posts.title: Tired
posts.markdown:
That's how I feel. I just finished a 2-weeks burnout, spending most of my time coding for a school project. The project consisted of spending a 4 month building a product (in order to create a startup). We had a nice advance (compared to the others teams) until we pivoted and start over less than a month before our presentation. The new idea was better and we were all very motivated.

We thought we could have been ready, but we were not. We were working day and night for it but we didn't catch up delay.

Seeing all the work we accomplished in such a small timeframe made me realize that I should spend more time mainkg stuff and spend less time consuming.

So this is my first step.

PS: burnout is not cool.

posts.title: Idea List #1
posts.markdown:
- Sell something with the lowest effort. Take a picture, set a price. done
- Share keychains, password /w family and coworkers
- Better sftp/ftp client /w Dropbox, Drive... interactions
posts.html:
• Sell something with the lowest effort. Take a picture, set a price. done
  • Share keychains, password /w family and coworkers
  • Better sftp/ftp client /w Dropbox, Drive... interactions

posts.title: Idea List #2
posts.markdown:
- A coach for lest than $20/week (to help/learn anything)
- Home cleaning/laundry for $30/week
- Style to amazon. Good looks w/ 1click to buy
- Find free high-quality internet access near you

posts.title: Idea List #3
posts.markdown:
- Online books club
- A services that helps you outsource accounting (for personal and companies)
- A '20/80' website where you find the best products for everyday use
- An app (for watch or phone) that opens the doors you can open (home, work...) = no more keys
- An app that sums a book, like "read a book in 30minutes"
- A service that babysits your animal (dogs, cats...) for hours, days, weeks
- Virtual desktops service that lets you install/use multiple software on different OSes accessible online
- A service that sends you a week of ingredients and 7 receipts to learn to cook with fixed priced. Starting with 2 formulas (student + normal) then add higher end formula.
- As a tourist, an app that helps you visit a city
posts.html:
• Online books club
  • A services that helps you outsource accounting (for personal and companies)
  • A '20/80' website where you find the best products for everyday use
  • An app (for watch or phone) that opens the doors you can open (home, work...) = no more keys
  • An app that sums a book, like "read a book in 30minutes"
  • A service that babysits your animal (dogs, cats...) for hours, days, weeks
  • Virtual desktops service that lets you install/use multiple software on different OSes accessible online
  • A service that sends you a week of ingredients and 7 receipts to learn to cook with fixed priced. Starting with 2 formulas (student + normal) then add higher end formula.
  • As a tourist, an app that helps you visit a city
